boat.construction_details: Glued lap clinker ply, Knees, Thwarts etc. Mahogany

for_sales.sales_text:
"Beth" is a Mallard 12" gunter rigged dinghy of clinker ply construction, complete with Jeckells sails, buoyancy bags (Holts), oars, paddles, fenders, rigging and most fittings in stainless steel. Sale also includes trailing cover (Jeckells) and lighting board on a galvanized combi trailer (Indespension) with spare wheel.

She is in very good condition, two owners from new and kept in a garaga. Regular use on sea, rivers and lakes.

These boats were designed by Norfolk marine architect Andrew Wolstenholme for The Boatman magazine, to be amateur built. However "Beth" was professionally built to a high standard for a local (Norfolk) industrial designer, by Paul Bown (Hunters yard etc.). She"s a popular class of boat for the OGA Trailer Section.

Can be seen near Daventry, Northants.

boat.full_description:
A Mallard 12' gunter rigged dinghy, 'Beth' is constructed in clinker ply construction. Originally designed for 'The Boatman' magazine by Andrew Wolstenholme to encourage amateur boat builders. 'Beth' was professionally built by Hunters Yard, Norfolk.

She's a popular class of boat with the OGA Trailer Section and has sailed extensively on lakes, rivers and the sea.
boat.name: Beth
boat.short_description: Beth was designed for the Boatman Magazine to appeal to amateur builders. She was built to sail at Hickling Broad Sailing Club, Norfolk.
